result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brett M. Hill

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:56 PM  Defendant Brett M. Hill appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angelina Scarpelli appears in court for Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht for State of Wisconsin.   SPD has yet to appoint counsel for Defendant in this matter.  Defendant would like to get the case moving and requests to represent himself.  Court goes over the Defendant's right to court appointed counsel.  Defendant wishes to exercise that right.  Defendant to fill out appropriate form and return it to the Court as soon as possible.  Court further finds good cause to toll time in which to conduct the preliminary examination.  Hearing is rescheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

10:56 am - Defendant Brett M. Hill appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Public defender has not been able to appoint counsel yet.  Defendant will wait.  Court finds good cause to toll time period.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:19 AM Defendant Brett M. Hill appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  PD's office has yet to appoint counsel in this matter.  Court continues to find good cause to waive time limits.  Court is informed by   Defendant will be released from jail on Monday and will be seeking his own counsel.  Court reschedules hearing.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

9:37 am - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brett M. Hill appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.   Public defender has not appointed counsel yet.  Court finds good cause to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 08-02-22 at 9:30 a.m.   
Minutes.
RE:  Maintain drug trafficking place-2nd or subsequent, on 06-30-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of keeper of drug house and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-25-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 1.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.    Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on PO hold.   Court orders photos and prints at MTPD MTSO TRPD.
Minutes.
